description: 499 Other Professional Services not Elsewhere Specified
comments: The OHSTC (Tribunal) requires the services of Appeals Officers to conduct appeal hearings or any portion there of and render written interim or final decisions in order to fulfill the legislative responsibilities set out in the enabling legislation, the Canada Labour Code (the Code) namely, under sections 129 and 146 following the filing of an appeal by an employee, employer or trade union of a Decision rendered or a Direction issued by the minister or her representative.
